item.title: Probability binning: simple and fast
item.description: Over the years, I’ve done a few data science coding challenges for job interviews. My favorite ones included a data set and asked me to address both specific and open-ended questions about that data set. One of the first things I usually do is make a bunch of histograms. Histograms are great because it’s an easy way to look at the distribution of data without having to plot every single point, or get distracted by a lot of noise.
